summary: Workflow worker hangs when starting on NodeJS 18.14.2 in production Linux containers, but works fine on NodeJS 16.17.0. Investigation revealed the root cause was incorrectly configured Node heap options.
userImpact: Users experience workflow worker hangs in production, requiring manual intervention or environment downgrade to resolve.
rootCause: Incorrectly configured Node heap options causing worker thread creation to hang on NodeJS 18.14.2
workaround: Downgrade to NodeJS 16.17.0 or reconfigure Node heap options correctly
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by correcting the Node heap configuration, allowing worker to start properly on NodeJS 18.14.2
keyQuote: Investigation revealed that issue was caused by incorrectly configured Node heap options
